author: d.-h.-lawrence

author: dennis-hume-wrong
quotes: Power is treated both as a quality or attribute possessed by individuals, groups, or larger social structures and as an indicator of an active or interactive process or relation between individual or collective actors.

The difference between having and exercising power, a version of the actual/potential distinction is thought to be obscured by the absence of a verb form, a problem that does not arise with influence or control.

The power that treats everything as an expression of power follows essentially from the conflation of the generic notion of power to with power over, which is social relation in which some persons possess and exercise power over others.
Power as the capacity to produce effects may be imputed to the agency as a dispositional property even when the capacity is not manifest in action.
Power is applied to physical phenomena and processes.
Power resembles and includes physical force or energy, for example the explosive power seen as residing in a bomb.

Power may be imputed to an actor when the probability of his intending to achieve and effectively achieving control over another actor is rated high, even though he may not have previously exercised such control.
Power to gratify their desires or realize their goals is to say no more than that they have desires and goals, that, in effect, they want to get what they want.
In recent years power has tended to become an even more diffuse and far-ranging notion in social and political theory.
Power is an essentially contested concept, meaning that people with difference values and beliefs are bound to disagree over its nature and definition.
Power therefore obviously relational, postulating something that acts on its environment and brings about some change in it.
Power as a capacity stating a potential relation to entities in its environment is no less as relational term when it is not actually realized in overt action.
Power is claimed that there cannot be any commonly accepted or even preferred meaning so long as people differ on normative issues as they are likely to do indefinitely, if not forever.
Power is often defined as a capacity to control or influence others.

Power is sometimes said to be potential rather than actua, to be possessed without being exercised, when others carry out the wishes or intentions of the power holder without his ever actually having issued a command to them or even having interacted with them at all to communicate his aims.

Power is of universal scope, applying to the physical world in general, including the human actions within it. Power is of universal scope, applying to the physical world in general, including the human actions within it.

Power penetrates the very core of human consciousness. It is implicated in anything and everything that can be said, which makes everything politics points to silences in the text that are held to reveal a presence confirmed by its very absence.
Power has always been one of those words that everybody uses without necessarily being able to define satisfactorily.

A power relation always implies that the person subject to it does something he or she would not otherwise have done, but it need not be something that is or is perceived as against his or her wishes or interests.
